intro: Dracaena newtoniana, commonly known as the Newton's dracaena, is a species of flowering plant in the Asparagaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its tall, slender stems and narrow, sword-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous white flowers that appear in clusters at the base of the leaves. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and air-purifying properties. Dracaena newtoniana prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil, making it suitable for indoor cultivation.
